metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15680 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.Description:
TightVNC code version 1.3.10 contains null pointer dereference inHandleZlibBPP function, which results Denial of System (DoS). This attackappear to be exploitable via network connectivity.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15680` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.4
libvncserver-config - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.4
libvncserver1 - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.4').
x11vnc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
ssvnc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
vncsnapshot: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
tightvnc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
